So, if someone else had a good understanding of the discussion, they would probably be someone who isn't affected by being in a wheelchair. Alternatively, the person with the notebook might have better comprehension because he's not physically restricted.

Alternatively, since the other person is using a wheelchair, which might make him less understood by others, so if someone else had a good understanding, it would be the one without the wheelchair. But I'm a bit confused because the context says that taking away a wheelchair affects physically disabled folks, implying that those who use wheelchairs are affected by being without them. So maybe if someone else had a good understanding, it would be the one with the notebook, as he isn't in a wheelchair and thus not part of that group.

I think I'll go with 'The man holding a notebook' because he's not physically restricted and might have better comprehension.
